channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OAK-1197] occasional test failure in org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.security.authorization.evaluation.MultipleSessionsACLStabilityTest.testAllowChild3
item.description:
I get the failure below quite frequently; apparently when not running mongodb.

(Platform W7 64bit)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.security.authorization.evaluation.MultipleSessionsACLStabilityTest
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 3, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.59 sec <<< FAILURE!

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
FWIW, the change below does not help:

Index: oak-core/src/test/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/oak/security/authorization/evaluation/MultipleSessionsACLStabilityTest.java
===================================================================
— oak-core/src/test/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/oak/security/authorization/evaluation/MultipleSessionsACLStabilityTest.java (revision 1543050)
+++ oak-core/src/test/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/oak/security/authorization/evaluation/MultipleSessionsACLStabilityTest.java (working copy)
@@ -97,6 +97,7 @@

setupPermission(testRoot1, "/a", testPrincipal, false, PrivilegeConstants.JCR_READ);

+ testRoot1.refresh();
assertFalse(rootTree1.hasChild("a"));
assertTrue(rootTree2.hasChild("a"));
Yesterday, I saw the exact same failure as well. It only happens occasionally on my system. I'm also on Windows 7 with Java 6.

Right now it happens reliably over here.

Can I help investigation? Should we disable the test for now?

Should we disable the test for now?

Yes. The build should pass reliably on all platforms.

I disabled the test in http://svn.apache.org/r1545172

The test fails on my platforms pretty consistently. Happens with Windows 7 & 8.1 and Java 6 & 7.
mreutegg, julian.reschke@gmx.de, could you check if this test still fails? IMO it might well be that this has been fixed with the recent modifications to the caching.
cannot repro anymore after recent ACL fixes
